file_content.text: I'm pretty sure you have places to be, Lieutenant.
Been fun, Lieutenant. I'll see you later.
Hey there, Lieutenant Hero. I was hoping you'd take me up on my offer.
Uh, Sergeant Jorgan, would you mind giving me and the lieutenant a bit of privacy here?
I wouldn't stay for a Medal of Valor.
Now that I have you all to myself--no techs watching through the armor-cam, no grumpy squad members--I can finally get to know this dashing new Havoc commander.
There's really not that much to tell.
What do you want to know?
That's not how I heard it. Word is you saw more action on Ord Mantell than most of us see in a whole tour.
But let's not talk about that now. To tell the truth, I didn't bring you here to talk.
Tell me about yourself, Jaxo.
I'd rather talk about you.
Me? What's to say? I've got a knack for being impulsive and undisciplined, so Garza puts me on undercover ops where I'll fit in.
But I didn't really ask you here to talk about me. Honestly, I didn't ask you here to talk at all.
Why did you ask me here, then?
What?
You need me to spell it out? I'm interested in you, Lieutenant. Very interested.
The feeling is definitely mutual, Jaxo.
I'm interested in you, too.
I'm just giving you a hard time, Jaxo.
I know, I was kidding.
I really can't have a relationship right now.
We can't be together, Jaxo.
We'll just have to think of something else to do.
Fine by me.
I've already got a plan in mind.
I've always preferred action over words.
Talk is a waste of time.
Then shut up and kiss me. Sir.
I'm not looking for a relationship, Jaxo.
Don't get the wrong idea.
You think I asked you here to marry me or something? Come on.
But hey, if you're not interested, you're not interested. Is that what I'm hearing?
You're great, Jaxo. I'm just not looking for anything serious.
No, I'm interested.
Maybe I'm not looking for anything serious either. Maybe you should just shut up and kiss me. Sir.
Hmm. Lieutenant, you keep on like this, and I might have to take a liking to you.
See that you do, Sergeant.
Go right ahead.
I'll take that as an order, sir.
What? You didn't like me already?
What's that supposed to mean?
Hated. Your. Guts. But my parents taught me to be polite to guests.
Long as you don't expect me to write you every day, you can do what you like.
Whatever.
Oh, so callous, so brash. Someone's feeling manly.
I'd better not keep you any longer or Garza will have me surveilling Hutt bathhouses for weeks for holding you up.
Be safe out there, Lieutenant. And keep in touch.
I hope I haven't hurt your feelings.
I'm sorry, but that's it.
How could you? I'm crushed. I'll never dare to love again, and so on and so on. Give me a break.
I'm not what most people would call the "sensitive" type, Lieutenant. Don't sweat it.
Anyway, I should let you get back to defending the Republic and all that. Thanks for stopping by.
Nothing is going to happen between us, Jaxo.
That's right, so get over it.
Aw, you're no fun at all. Suit yourself.
I've got some stuff to take care of. You know where the door is.
Hope we run into each other again sometime.
It's been fun, Lieutenant.
Hey, you're back! Was the op a success? Were you able to neutralize the Trivoris?
That's affirmative.
It wasn't easy.
I wouldn't expect anything less from a man like you.
I can't believe they wasted my time on a mission like this.
This op was below me.
Hey, sorry, Lieutenant Supersoldier. But not everyone is as good as you.
Well, I hope you don't feel like the whole thing was a waste of time.
How about that red case? Were you able to grab whatever was inside?
The case contained this blaster, Sergeant.
I have it right here.
Black Sun has kindly supplied this blaster to aid the Republic war effort.
A deadly weapon, as expected.
I've never seen one quite like it. Must be some sort of new prototype.
Here you go--a big, dangerous present from the Black Sun.
I got this just for you.
Oh, you shouldn't have. Looks like some kind of high-tech prototype blaster--you definitely know how to shop for a lady.
I'll take it back to headquarters for analysis--maybe we can find out where Black Sun is getting their weapons.
I found the case, but there wasn't anything inside.
[Lie] The case was empty.
Ridiculous.
That's a bit of a setback. We hoped the case might have weapons or tech that could lead us to Black Sun's suppliers.
Thanks for trying. I'm sure if there was anything to be found, you would've found it.
Guess we're through here, then. It's been fun, Lieutenant. I hope we get to run together again sometime.
Looks like we're all done here. It's been a blast, Lieutenant. I hope we get to work together again sometime.
Good day, Sergeant.
Dismissed.
See you around, Lieutenant.
I'll be sure to put your name forward the next time I need backup.
Me, too.
Sounds good to me. See you later.
Yeah, yeah. So long.
Whatever.
I'll, uh, I'll see you around, then.
I've got some post-mission stuff to take care of but maybe we could get together sometime--get to know each other better. Interested?
I'd really like that, Jaxo.
Definitely.
So would I.
I'll have to think about it, Jaxo.
I don't know, maybe.
Please see that you do. Sir.
General Garza will be keeping you busy for a while but once she cuts you loose, just swing by--I'll be around.
That won't be happening, Sergeant.
Afraid not.
Aw, you're breaking my heart, here.
Well, if you change your mind, I'll be here. Feel free to come by when General Garza's done running you all over Coruscant.
See you later.
Be careful neutralizing that gas, Lieutenant. And don't forget the red case.
Hey there, you must be the new Havoc CO. I'm Jaxo. It's good to meet you.
No offense, but you don't look much like a SpecForce soldier.
You're my contact?
That's good to hear. I do deep cover work--looking rank-and-file isn't wise. Now let's get to your mission.
Wow. You're the new Havoc CO? Must be my lucky day. I'm Jaxo. It's a real pleasure to meet you.
It's good to meet you, too, Sergeant.
Likewise.
Hope you're ready for some fun, Lieutenant. You've got your work cut out for you.
Working with a beautiful woman on a dangerous mission--I'd say it's my lucky day.
[Flirt] The pleasure is mine.
You want to focus, sir? We've got a job to do down here, remember?
Nothing says your boss can't have a little fun, Sergeant. Let's get those op details out of the way.
Well, as long as we're both feeling lucky, why don't we get that mission out of the way?
Is that how you greet a superior officer, Sergeant Jaxo?
I expect a salute.
No offense, but I'm undercover and military etiquette doesn't really fit in with these people. And speaking of these people....
Your highly enviable task is to destroy a cache of nerve gas canisters that the Black Sun syndicate is shipping to Tavus.
The gas is called Trivoris. Scary stuff--one canister can cover a square kilometer, with one hundred percent fatality inside of ten minutes.
Can't say I'm too excited about being near this stuff.
Ouch.
No joke. Volunteers aren't exactly lining up for the pleasure.
Do we have any way to safely deal with this stuff?
How do I destroy it?
A street gang with nerve gas? You've got to be kidding.
This is insane.
I'd say selling weapons-grade nerve gas puts Black Sun well outside the "street gang" category.
Lucky for us, it's pretty easy to neutralize Trivoris--at least while it's still in the canisters.
The compound in this bottle renders Trivoris completely inert on contact. Just plug it into the canisters inside the Black Sun base, and the whole batch is history.
Understood.
Yeah, but you'll have to shoot your way past Black Sun's toughest enforcers to do it.
Should I just leave the neutralized gas behind?
What about the canisters?
Once the Trivoris is neutralized, it's useless--no need to retrieve it. General Garza said not to bother.
I'd rather have the whole place vaped from orbit.
Forget the chemistry.
Uh, with respect, sir, vaporizing the Trivoris would just spread it through the air--which, for the record, is bad.
You also have another objective. A few hours ago, a bright red case was moved into the Black Sun's base under heavy guard.
If whatever's inside that case is valuable to Black Sun--it's bad news for us. So your job will be to find the case and bring me its contents.
I'll take care of it.
This will be easy.
I just can't say no to you, Jaxo.
[Flirt] Anything for you.
Well. I'll have to keep that in mind.
You don't give me orders, Sergeant.
Don't tell me what to do.
These are Garza's orders--sir--not mine. I'm just the messenger.
One last detail: Black Sun has signal jammers throughout their base, so General Garza won't know to send help if you get in over your head.
I'll be sure to stay alert, Sergeant.
Thanks for the heads-up.
I'm sure you can handle yourself, but I wanted to be sure you got all the facts.
Just be sure that handsome face of yours makes it back in one piece.
Is there any way to shut down the jammers?
Can we break the jamming?
Nah. The jammers are built into the walls of the hideout. It would take hours to bore them all out and trash them.
This constant surveillance was getting on my nerves anyway.
I never liked being watched.
You should enjoy it while you can--I never get that kind of support on my ops.
Once you've taken care of the Trivoris canisters and nabbed whatever's inside that red case, be sure to meet me back here to confirm the mission results. Good luck, Lieutenant.
Hey, how's it going, Lieutenant?
Just keep right on walking.
Come back and see me later, Lieutenant. I'll be around.
